result.title: Ideas for Different Type of DP problems
result.content:
Recently I encountered a problem which I simplified to a dp relation similar to

dp(i,j) = dp(x1,j1) + dp(x2,j2) + ..... + dp(xn,jn)

such that j1 + j2 + ... + jn = j. (Let us say n is quite small, <=10)

Now, I am thinking is there an easy way to solve this as the constraints on j are quite high (of the order of 10^4) and it would be impossible to generate all possible n-tuples which sum upto j for each value of j. Could it possibly be done by matrix exponentiation?
